From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

English

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From imagine +‎ -er.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (US) IPA(key): /ɪˈmæd͡ʒɪnɚ/
  • Audio (Southern England):(file)

Noun

[edit]

imaginer (plural imaginers)

  1. One who imagines (something).
    • 2007 March 18, Terrence Rafferty, “Ice Men”, in New York Times‎[1]:
      Although Simmons, as a professional purveyor of horror and fantasy, is no dim imaginer, he has his work cut out for him.

Synonyms

[edit]
  • imaginator

Anagrams

[edit]
  • migraine, reaiming, regimina

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old French imaginer.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /i.ma.ʒi.ne/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

imaginer

  1. to imagine
    Synonym: fantasier

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Derived terms

[edit]
  • imaginable
  • imagination

Descendants

[edit]
  • → Romanian: imagina

Further reading

[edit]
  • “imaginer”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • migraine

Latin

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]

(Classical Latin) IPA(key): [ɪˈmaː.ɡɪ.nɛr]

  • (modern Italianate Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): [iˈmaː.d͡ʒi.ner]

Verb

[edit]

imāginer

  1. first-person singular present active subjunctive of imāginor

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin imāginārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imad͡ʒiˈneːɾ/

Verb

[edit]

imaginer

  1. to examine; to look at
  2. to depict in the form of an image
  3. to contemplate; to think about

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a first-group verb ending in -er. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of imaginer (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive imaginer avoir imaginé
gerund en imaginant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle imaginant
past participle imaginé
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present imagin imagines imagine imaginons imaginez imaginent
imperfect imaginoie, imagineie, imaginoe, imagineve imaginoies, imagineies, imaginoes, imagineves imaginoit, imagineit, imaginot, imagineve imaginiiens, imaginiens imaginiiez, imaginiez imaginoient, imagineient, imaginoent, imaginevent
preterite imaginai imaginas imagina imaginames imaginastes imaginerent
future imaginerai imagineras imaginera imaginerons imagineroiz, imaginereiz, imaginerez imagineront
conditional imagineroie, imaginereie imagineroies, imaginereies imagineroit, imaginereit imagineriiens, imagineriens imagineriiez, imagineriez imagineroient, imaginereient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
